        @PostMapping("/contact")
public java.lang.String sendEmailToClient​(@RequestParam("subject")
                                          java.lang.String subject,
                                          @RequestParam("message")
                                          java.lang.String message,
                                          @RequestParam("eMail")
                                          java.lang.String mailFrom,
                                          org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Maps post method for the contact page
        Parameters:
        subject - a string of email subject
        message - a string of email message body
        mailFrom - a string of email address from the user input
        model - a Model object holding model attributes
        Returns:
        the JSP name for the contact-success page

      • deleteUser

        @PostMapping("/deleteUser")
public java.lang.String deleteUser​(@RequestParam("message")
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Maps post method for the deleteUser request This page is not accessible without a valid credential so the exception is not expected to be thrown.
        Parameters:
        message - a string of message from the user input
        model - a Model object holding model attributes
        request - a HttpServletRequest object to automatically log the user out after deleting its account
        Returns:
        the JSP name for the main page if no exception is caught, the login page otherwise
